required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Sexuality of the Infertile Couple
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Sexuality of the Infertile Couple: Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study hypothesis is that infertile couples experience an impact of their sexuality impacted during the diagnostic process carried out as part of the medically assisted procreation assessment, and also by the announcement of the possible cause of the couple's infertility. It is also conceivable that a disorder of the couple's sexuality forms the origin of, or is a contributor to, infertility.

primary_outcome.measure: Sexuality of the female of the couple
primary_outcome.description: Female sexual function index: The total score is between 2 and 36 with sexual dysfunction indicated for scores below 26.55

primary_outcome.measure: Sexuality of the female of the couple
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day prior to the infertility assessment diagnosis
primary_outcome.description: Female sexual function index: The total score is between 2 and 36 with sexual dysfunction indicated for scores below 26.55

Sexuality of the male of the couple
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day prior to the infertility assessment diagnosis

Ejactulation of the male of the couple
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day prior to the infertility assessment diagnosis

Body satisfaction and global self-perception of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire de satisfaction corporelle et de perception globale de soi (QSCPGS): total score ranges from -100 to +100.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day prior to the infertility assessment diagnosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Body satisfaction and global self-perception of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire de satisfaction corporelle et de perception globale de soi (QSCPGS): total score ranges from -100 to +100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship satisfaction of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.description: Dyadic Adjustment Scale-16 Distress if score less than 92 and without distress if the score is higher than 107

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship satisfaction of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day prior to the infertility assessment diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Dyadic Adjustment Scale-16 Distress if score less than 92 and without distress if the score is higher than 107

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship satisfaction of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.description: Dyadic Adjustment Scale-16 Distress if score less than 92 and without distress if the score is higher than 107

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-esteem of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.description: Rosenberg self-esteem scale: The score is between 10 and 40. A score below 25 indicates very low self-esteem. A score between 25 and 31 indicates low self-esteem. A score between 31 and 34 indicates average self-esteem. A score between 34 and 39 indicates strong self-esteem. A score above 39 indicates very high self-esteem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-esteem of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day prior to the infertility assessment diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Rosenberg self-esteem scale: The score is between 10 and 40. A score below 25 indicates very low self-esteem. A score between 25 and 31 indicates low self-esteem. A score between 31 and 34 indicates average self-esteem. A score between 34 and 39 indicates strong self-esteem. A score above 39 indicates very high self-esteem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-esteem of both members of the couple
secondary_outcome.description: Rosenberg self-esteem scale: The score is between 10 and 40. A score below 25 indicates very low self-esteem. A score between 25 and 31 indicates low self-esteem. A score between 31 and 34 indicates average self-esteem. A score between 34 and 39 indicates strong self-esteem. A score above 39 indicates very high self-esteem.

intervention.description: Panel of questionnaires assessing sexuality, relationship satisfaction, and body image

study_pop.textblock: 60 heterosexual infertile couples (according to the WHO definition) followed at the Nîmes University Hospital in the Urology / Gynecology departments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Couple in which each of the two partners has signed the consent form which is presented separately and independently of their partner.
- The patient must be a member or beneficiary of a health insurance plan
- Heterosexual infertile couple (according to the WHO definition) monitored at the Nîmes University Hospital in the urology / gynecology departments.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject is participating in a category 1 interventional study, or is in a period of exclusion determined by a previous study
- One member of the couple refuses to sign the consent
- It is impossible to give the subject informed information
- The patient is under safeguard of justice or state guardianship
- Patient without good level of written and spoken French
